授業目的:
<Reading> The aim of this course is to continue to build on students' intensive and extensive reading skills by reading about a variety of current events and policy topics. Students will use graded readers to improve their reading fluency and vocabulary, and improve their critical reading skills.
＜Presentation＞ The aim of the course is to develop group presentation skills to describe a social problem and suggest possible solutions with secondary data support.  
＜Seminar＞ The purpose of this course is to develop students' academic discussion skills focusing on social issues. 
＜Writing＞ The purpose of this course is to continue to develop the academic writing skills learned in EC3 Writing.
到達目標:
<Reading> Students will be able to: 1) increase their ability to comprehend academic and current events-related texts 2) expand their knowledge of vocabulary 3) improve their reading speed and fluency and 4) strengthen their critical, analytical reading skills.
<Presentation> Students will be able to use a variety of presentation language to coherently guide the audience through their presentation and describe their data and central arguments. Students will be able to create effective visual aids and source reliable data. 
<Seminar> Students learn vocabulary, how to use discussion questions, and discussion skills. Students also learn how to evaluate information on the web.
<Writing> Students review the paragraph writing skills from EC3 Writing, and develop two-paragraph essays with introductions and conclusions. They will also learn about supporting their opinions with facts and use an outside source in their essays. Students also develop and put to practice their understanding of the writing process.
特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
【合併】English Communication IV　Ｃ（総合政策学部）/英語コミュニケーションIV　Ｃ（総合政策学部）
授業方法: <all> Materials, instruction, and all class communication are in English.

トピック.授業計画1:
<Listening> Students complete listening, reading, and communication activities related to four unit topics: Study Abroad, Social Media, Global/Local Issue, & Volunteering. Students also attend Research Fair presentations. <Presentation> Students will improve their ability to give a presentation in English confidently and comfortably  over the course of three presentations. For each presentation, students will concentrate on several aspects of public speaking while using and improving on the skills practiced before. 
<Seminar> Students will develop an ability to discuss a topic with a group. The topics will challenge students to think beyond their experiences and cultural influences. 
<Writing> Students will complete two two-draft essays that include introductions, outside sources, and conclusions. In addition, students will also complete two other writing tasks as further practice.
トピック.授業外学習2:
<Listening> Students listen to audio recordings, read short articles, and complete language development activities.  
<Presentation> Students will be required to work individually or as a group to prepare and practice their presentations and to do self reflections after the presentations have been completed. 
<Seminar> Students read articles and discuss them in class. Students learn vocabulary, ask discussion questions, and use discussion skills. Students find information on the Internet evaluate it.
<Writing> Students complete writing activities, study model essays, and apply their understanding of the writing process by planning and drafting essays. They are also required to revise their essay assignments based on teacher feedback. They also complete two Turnitin tasks and study for an outside source test.
